title: Ratio of kinetic energy of blocks after collision

content.question: A block of mass m slides along a frictionless surface with kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. It collides with a block of mass <math alttext="3 m " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is initially at rest, and the two blocks stick together and slide with total kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="K sub f to K sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
